column4: sweet. ok well first off. im downloading the install iso, i got the live cd first, but that isnt what i wanted. anyways, im wondering when i go to install it will it remove my windows? (that is what i want)
ok cool, and when im removing windows, do i have the option to move some folder around? like documents and mp3's?
ok, so i should back up my inportant things then...and once it is done installing, when i turn on my pc, it will boot straight into ubuntu right?
now, are there any themes and stuff....kind of like windowsblinds?
cool, and ubuntu comes with the nessecary things like firefox and a media player and a chat (IM) program right?

oh yeah. my main concern with all this is, i am using a wireless router, the actual modem is upstairs...and i have been told that ubuntu wont read my driver disks and stuff..so how am i to get on the internet? like how do i configure my router?
you will need ot install the codecs etc but thats an easy menu option
you will just use dhcp to connect to the router..
no driver needed unless you connect the modem directly to the ubuntu box
what wireless card do you have in the ubuntu box?
you are connecting the router to the ubuntu box with usb?
then you might need a driver... what router model is it?
might be a problem, if you can connect it with ethernet then it will work fine
